properties.areaDesc: Cloud; Republic; Washington; Clay; Marshall; Ottawa
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 9:06AM CST until January 11 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Topeka KS
properties.description:
...Dangerous Travel Conditions Likely Friday Afternoon through
Saturday...

A strong storm system will approach the region late tonight into
Friday with rainfall overspreading much of northeast and east
central Kansas. Temperatures will rapidly fall during the
afternoon and evening hours Friday, transitioning precipitation
to a wintry mix of freezing rain and sleet. All precipitation is
expected to transition to snow by sunrise Saturday morning, with
periods of moderate to heavy snow continuing through Saturday
afternoon.

* WHAT...This morning, light freezing rain will occur, which is
expected to transition to snow and sleet this afternoon. Total
ice accumulations of less than one tenth of an inch is possible
this morning. Snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches is then
possible through tomorrow morning. Winds gusting as high as 40
mph.

* WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Kansas.

* WHEN...Until noon CST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could
significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions
could impact the evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Two waves are expected from this system.
The first should bring freezing rain this morning then mostly
snow by the afternoon with some mix of sleet also possible.
There may be a lull overnight before the second wave brings all
snow to the area Saturday morning.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY
